   19: %%
   20: 
   21: %% There are some environment variables that can be used to "manipulate"
   22: %% the test suite: 
   23: %%
   24: %% Variable that controls which 'groups' are to run (with default values)
   25: %%
   26: %%         ESOCK_TEST_TRAFFIC_COUNTERS:   include
   27: %%         ESOCK_TEST_TRAFFIC_CHUNKS:     include
   28: %%         ESOCK_TEST_TRAFFIC_PING_PONG:  include
   29: %%
   30: %% Variable that controls "verbosity" of the test case(s):
   31: %%
   32: %%         ESOCK_TEST_QUIET: true (default) | false
   33: %%
   34: 
   35: %% Run the entire test suite: 
   36: %% ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, [batch]).
   37: %%
   38: %% Run a specific group:
   39: %% ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, {group, foo}, [batch]).
   40: %%
   41: %% Run a specific test case:
   42: %% ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, foo, [batch]).
   43: %%
   44: %% (cd /mnt/c/$LOCAL_TESTS/26/kernel_test/ && $ERL_TOP/bin/win32/erl.exe -sname kernel-26-tester -pa c:$LOCAL_TESTS/26/test_server)
   45: %% application:set_env(kernel, test_inet_backends, true).
   46: %% S = fun() -> ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, [batch]) end.
   47: %% S = fun(SUITE) -> ts:run(kernel, SUITE, [batch]) end.
   48: %% S = fun() -> ct:run_test([{suite, socket_SUITE}]) end.
   49: %% S = fun(SUITE) -> ct:run_test([{suite, SUITE}]) end.
   50: %% G = fun(GROUP) -> ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, {group, GROUP}, [batch]) end.
   51: %% G = fun(SUITE, GROUP) -> ts:run(kernel, SUITE, {group, GROUP}, [batch]) end.
   52: %% G = fun(GROUP) -> ct:run_test([{suite, socket_SUITE}, {group, GROUP}]) end.
   53: %% G = fun(SUITE, GROUP) -> ct:run_test([{suite, SUITE}, {group, GROUP}]) end.
   54: %% T = fun(TC) -> ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, TC, [batch]) end.
   55: %% T = fun(TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, socket_SUITE}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   56: %% T = fun(S, TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, S}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   57: %% T = fun(S, G, TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, S}, {group, G}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   58: %%
   59: %% Some official info about AF_UNIX
   60: %% https://devblogs.microsoft.com/commandline/windowswsl-interop-with-af_unix/
   61: 
   62: 
   63: 
   64: -module(socket_traffic_SUITE).
   65: 
   66: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   67: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct_event.hrl").
   68: -include("socket_test_evaluator.hrl").
   69: -include("kernel_test_lib.hrl").
   70: 
   71: %% Suite exports
   72: -export([suite/0, all/0, groups/0]).
   73: -export([init_per_suite/1,    end_per_suite/1,
   74:          init_per_group/2,    end_per_group/2,
   75:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   76:

  154: -define(SLIB,       socket_test_lib).
  155: -define(KLIB,       kernel_test_lib).
  156: -define(LOGGER,     socket_test_logger).

  158: -define(DATA,       <<"HOPPSAN">>). % Temporary
  159: -define(FAIL(R),    exit(R)).
  160: 
  161: -define(TPP_SMALL,  lists:seq(1, 8)).
  162: -define(TPP_MEDIUM, lists:flatten(lists:duplicate(100, ?TPP_SMALL))).
  163: -define(TPP_LARGE,  lists:flatten(lists:duplicate(100, ?TPP_MEDIUM))).
  164: 
  165: -define(TPP_SMALL_NUM,  5000).
  166: -define(TPP_MEDIUM_NUM, 500).
  167: -define(TPP_LARGE_NUM,  50).
  168: -define(TPP_NUM(Config, Base), (Base) div lookup(kernel_factor, 1, Config)).

  171: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  172: 
  173: suite() ->
  174:     [{ct_hooks, [ts_install_cth]},
  175:      {timetrap, {minutes,1}}].
  176: 
  177: all() -> 
  178:     Groups = [{counters,  "ESOCK_TEST_TRAFFIC_COUNTERS",  include},
  179:               {chunks,    "ESOCK_TEST_TRAFFIC_CHUNKS",    include},
  180:               {ping_pong, "ESOCK_TEST_TRAFFIC_PING_PONG", include}],
  181:     [use_group(Group, Env, Default) || {Group, Env, Default} <- Groups].
  182: 
  183: use_group(_Group, undefined, exclude) ->
  184:     [];
  185: use_group(Group, undefined, _Default) ->
  186:     [{group, Group}];
  187: use_group(Group, Env, Default) ->
  188: 	case os:getenv(Env) of
  189: 	    false when (Default =:= include) ->
  190: 		[{group, Group}];
  191: 	    false ->
  192: 		[];
  193: 	    Val ->
  194: 		case list_to_atom(string:to_lower(Val)) of
  195: 		    Use when (Use =:= include) orelse 
  196: 			     (Use =:= enable) orelse 
  197: 			     (Use =:= true) ->
  198: 			[{group, Group}];
  199: 		    _ ->
  200: 			[]
  201: 		end
  202: 	end.
  203:     
  204: 
  205: groups() -> 
  206:     [{counters,            [], traffic_counters_cases()},
  207:      {chunks,              [], traffic_chunks_cases()},
  208:      {ping_pong,           [], traffic_ping_pong_cases()},
  209:      {pp_send_recv,        [], traffic_pp_send_recv_cases()},
  210:      {pp_sendto_recvfrom,  [], traffic_pp_sendto_recvfrom_cases()},
  211:      {pp_sendmsg_recvmsg,  [], traffic_pp_sendmsg_recvmsg_cases()}
  212:     ].
  213:

  307: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  308: 
  309: init_per_suite(Config0) ->
  310:     os:internal_init_cmd_shell(),
  311:     ?P("init_per_suite -> entry with"
  312:        "~n      Config: ~p"
  313:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [Config0, erlang:nodes()]),
  314:     
  315:     try socket:info() of
  316:         #{} ->
  317:             case ?KLIB:init_per_suite(Config0) of
  318:                 {skip, _} = SKIP ->
  319:                     SKIP;
  320: 
  321:                 Config1 when is_list(Config1) ->
  322: 
  323:                     ?P("init_per_suite -> end when "
  324:                        "~n      Config: ~p", [Config1]),
  325: 
  326:                     %% We need a monitor on this node also
  327:                     kernel_test_sys_monitor:start(),
  328: 
  329:                     socket:use_registry(false),
  330:                     case quiet_mode(Config1) of
  331:                         default ->
  332:                             case ?LOGGER:start() of
  333:                                 ok ->
  334:                                     Config1;
  335:                                 {error, Reason} ->
  336:                                     ?P("init_per_suite -> "
  337:                                        "Failed starting logger"
  338:                                        "~n   Reason: ~p"
  339:                                        "~n", [Reason]),
  340:                                     {skip, "Failed starting logger"}
  341:                             end;
  342:                         Quiet ->
  343:                             case ?LOGGER:start(Quiet) of
  344:                                 ok ->
  345:                                     [{esock_test_quiet, Quiet} | Config1];
  346:                                 {error, Reason} ->
  347:                                     ?P("init_per_suite -> "
  348:                                        "Failed starting logger"
  349:                                        "~n   Reason: ~p"
  350:                                        "~n", [Reason]),
  351:                                     {skip, "Failed starting logger"}
  352:                             end
  353:                     end
  354:             end
  355:     catch
  356:         error : notsup ->
  357:             {skip, "esock not supported"};
  358:         error : undef ->
  359:             {skip, "esock not configured"}
  360:     end.
  361: 
  362: end_per_suite(Config0) ->
  363: 
  364:     ?P("end_per_suite -> entry with"
  365:        "~n      Config: ~p"
  366:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [Config0, erlang:nodes()]),
  367: 
  368:     %% Stop the local monitor
  369:     kernel_test_sys_monitor:stop(),
  370: 
  371:     (catch ?LOGGER:stop()),
  372: 
  373:     Config1 = ?KLIB:end_per_suite(Config0),
  374: 
  375:     ?P("end_per_suite -> "
  376:        "~n      Nodes: ~p", [erlang:nodes()]),
  377: 
  378:     Config1.
  379: 
  380: 
  381: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  382:     Config.
  383: 
  384: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  385:     Config.
  386: 
  387: 
  388: init_per_testcase(_TC, Config) ->
  389:     io:format("init_per_testcase(~w) -> entry with"
  390:               "~n   Config: ~p"
  391:               "~n", [_TC, Config]),
  392:     Config.
  393: 
  394: end_per_testcase(_TC, Config) ->
  395:     Config.
  396: 
  397: 
  398: quiet_mode(Config) ->
  399:     case lists:keysearch(esock_test_quiet, 1, Config) of
  400:         {value, {esock_test_quiet, Quiet}} ->
  401:             Quiet;
  402:         false ->
  403:             case os:getenv("ESOCK_TEST_QUIET") of
  404:                 "true"  -> true;
  405:                 "false" -> false;
  406:                 _       -> default
  407:             end
  408:     end.
  409: 
  410: 
  411: 
  412: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  413: %% This test case is intended to (simply) test that the counters
  414: %% for both read and write.
  415: %% So that its easy to extend, we use fun's for read and write.
  416: %% We use TCP on IPv4.
  417: 
  418: traffic_send_and_recv_counters_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  419:     ?TT(?SECS(15)),
  420:     tc_try(traffic_send_and_recv_counters_tcp4,
  421:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
  422:            fun() ->
  423:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
  424:                                  proto  => tcp,
  425:                                  recv   => fun(S)    -> socket:recv(S)    end,
  426:                                  send   => fun(S, D) -> socket:send(S, D) end},
  427:                    ok = traffic_send_and_recv_stream(InitState)
  428:            end).
  429: 
  430: 
  431: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  432: %% This test case is intended to (simply) test that the counters
  433: %% for both read and write.
  434: %% So that its easy to extend, we use fun's for read and write.
  435: %% We use TCP on IPv6.
  436: 
  437: traffic_send_and_recv_counters_tcp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  438:     ?TT(?SECS(15)),
  439:     tc_try(traffic_send_and_recv_counters_tcp6,
  440:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
  441:            fun() ->
  442:                    InitState = #{domain => inet6,
  443:                                  proto  => tcp,
  444:                                  recv   => fun(S)    -> socket:recv(S)    end,
  445:                                  send   => fun(S, D) -> socket:send(S, D) end},
  446:                    ok = traffic_send_and_recv_stream(InitState)
  447:            end).
  448: 
  449: 
  450: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  451: %% This test case is intended to (simply) test that the counters
  452: %% for both read and write.
  453: %% So that its easy to extend, we use fun's for read and write.
  454: %% We use default (TCP) on local.
  455: 
  456: traffic_send_and_recv_counters_tcpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  457:     ?TT(?SECS(15)),
  458:     tc_try(traffic_send_and_recv_counters_tcpL,
  459:            fun() -> has_support_unix_domain_socket() end,
  460:            fun() ->
  461:                    InitState = #{domain => local,
  462:                                  proto  => default,
  463:                                  recv   => fun(S)    -> socket:recv(S)    end,
  464:                                  send   => fun(S, D) -> socket:send(S, D) end},
  465:                    ok = traffic_send_and_recv_stream(InitState)
  466:            end).
  467: 
  468: 
  469: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  470: %% This test case is intended to (simply) test that the counters
  471: %% for both read and write.
  472: %% So that its easy to extend, we use fun's for read and write.
  473: %% We use SCTP on IPv4.
  474: 
  475: traffic_send_and_recv_counters_sctp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  476:     ?TT(?SECS(15)),
  477:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
  478:            fun() ->
  479:                    has_support_ipv4(),
  480:                    has_support_sctp()
  481:            end,
  482:            fun() ->
  483:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
  484:                                  proto  => sctp,
  485:                                  recv   => fun(S)    -> socket:recv(S)    end,
  486:                                  send   => fun(S, D) -> socket:send(S, D) end},
  487:                    ok = traffic_send_and_recv_stream(InitState)
  488:            end).
  489: 
  490:

  521:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
  522:            fun() ->
  523:                    is_not_windows(),
  524:                    has_support_ipv4()
  525:            end,
  526:            fun() ->
  527:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
  528:                                  proto  => tcp,
  529:                                  recv   => fun(S) ->
  530:                                                    case socket:recvmsg(S) of
  531:                                                        {ok, #{iov  := [Data]}} ->
  532:                                                            {ok, Data};
  533:                                                        {error, _} = ERROR ->
  534:                                                            ERROR
  535:                                                    end
  536:                                            end,
  537:                                  send   => fun(S, Data) ->
  538:                                                    Msg = #{iov => [Data]},
  539:                                                    socket:sendmsg(S, Msg)
  540:                                            end},
  541:                    ok = traffic_send_and_recv_stream(InitState)
  542:            end).

  587:            fun() ->
  588:                    InitState = #{domain => local,
  589:                                  proto  => default,
  590:                                  recv   => fun(S) ->
  591:                                                    case socket:recvmsg(S) of

  595:                                                            ERROR
  596:                                                    end
  597:                                            end,
  598:                                  send   => fun(S, Data) ->
  599:                                                    Msg = #{iov => [Data]},
  600:                                                    socket:sendmsg(S, Msg)

  602:                    ok = traffic_send_and_recv_stream(InitState)

  657:                                                    case socket:recvmsg(S) of

  659:                                                            {ok, Data};
  660:                                                        {error, _} = ERROR ->
  661:                                                            ERROR
  662:                                                    end

  665:                                                    Msg = #{iov => [Data]},

  669:            end).
  670: 
  671: 
  672: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  673: 
  674: traffic_send_and_recv_stream(InitState) ->
  675:     ServerSeq =
  676:         [
  677:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
  678:          #{desc => "await start",
  679:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
  680:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
  681:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
  682:                    end},
  683:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
  684:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
  685:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
  686:                            ok
  687:                    end},
  688: 
  689:          %% *** Init part ***
  690:          #{desc => "which local address",
  691:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
  692:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
  693:                            {ok, State#{local_sa => LSA}}
  694:                    end},
  695:          #{desc => "create listen socket",
  696:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain, proto := Proto} = State) ->
  697:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
  698:                                {ok, Sock} ->
  699:                                    {ok, State#{lsock => Sock}};
  700:                                {error, eafnosupport = Reason} ->
  701:                                    {skip, Reason};
  702:                                {error, eprotonosupport = Reason} ->
  703:                                    {skip, Reason};
  704:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
  705:                                    ERROR
  706:                            end
  707:                    end},
  708:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
  709:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
  710:                          lsock    := LSock,
  711:                          local_sa := LSA} = _State) ->
  712:                            case socket:bind(LSock, LSA) of
  713:                                ok ->
  714:                                    ok; % We do not care about the port for local
  715:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
  716:                                    ERROR
  717:                            end;
  718:                       (#{lsock    := LSock,
  719:                          local_sa := LSA} = State) ->
  720:                            case sock_bind(LSock, LSA) of
  721:                                ok ->
  722:                                    Port = sock_port(LSock),
  723:                                    {ok, State#{lport => Port}};
  724:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
  725:                                    ERROR
  726:                            end
  727:                    end},
  728:          #{desc => "make listen socket",
  729:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock}) ->
  730:                            socket:listen(LSock)
  731:                    end},
  732:          #{desc => "initial (listen socket) counter validation (=zero)",
  733:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock} = _State) ->
  734:                            try socket:info(LSock) of
  735:                                #{counters := Counters} ->
  736:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Validate initial listen socket counters: "
  737:                                                "~s", [format_counters(listen,
  738:                                                                       Counters)]),
  739:                                    traffic_sar_counters_validation(Counters)
  740:                            catch
  741:                                C:E:S ->
  742:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed get socket info: "
  743:                                                "~n   Class: ~p"
  744:                                                "~n   Error: ~p"
  745:                                                "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),
  746:                                    {error, {socket_info_failed, {C, E, S}}}
  747:                            end
  748:                    end},
  749:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
  750:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
  751:                          tester   := Tester,
  752:                          local_sa := #{path := Path}}) ->
  753:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Path),
  754:                            ok;
  755:                       (#{tester   := Tester,
  756:                          lport    := Port}) ->
  757:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Port),
  758:                            ok
  759:                    end},
  760: 
  761:          %% The actual test
  762:          #{desc => "await continue (accept)",
  763:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
  764:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, accept)
  765:                    end},
  766:          #{desc => "accept",
  767:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock} = State) ->
  768:                            case socket:accept(LSock) of
  769:                                {ok, CSock} ->
  770:                                    #{counters := LCnts} = socket:info(LSock),
  771:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Validate listen counters: "
  772:                                                "~s", [format_counters(listen,
  773:                                                                       LCnts)]),
  774:                                    traffic_sar_counters_validation(
  775:                                      LCnts,
  776:                                      [{acc_success, 1},
  777:                                       {acc_fails,   0},
  778:                                       {acc_tries,   1},
  779:                                       {acc_waits,   0}]),
  780:                                    #{counters := CCnts} = socket:info(CSock),
  781:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Validate initial accept counters: "
  782:                                                "~s", [format_counters(CCnts)]),
  783:                                    traffic_sar_counters_validation(CCnts),
  784:                                    {ok, State#{csock => CSock}};
  785:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
  786:                                    ERROR
  787:                            end
  788:                    end},
  789:          #{desc => "initial counter validation (=zero)",
  790:            cmd  => fun(#{csock := Sock} = _State) ->
  791:                            try socket:info(Sock) of
  792:                                #{counters := Counters} ->
  793:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Validate initial counters: "
  794:                                                "~s", [format_counters(Counters)]),
  795:                                    traffic_sar_counters_validation(Counters)
  796:                            catch
  797:                                C:E:S ->
  798:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed get socket info: "
  799:                                                "~n   Class: ~p"
  800:                                                "~n   Error: ~p"
  801:                                                "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),
  802:                                    {error, {socket_info_failed, {C, E, S}}}
  803:                            end
  804:                    end},
  805:          #{desc => "announce ready (accept)",
  806:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
  807:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, accept),
  808:                            ok
  809:                    end},
  810: 
  811:          #{desc => "await continue (recv_and_validate 1)",
  812:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
  813:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, recv_and_validate)
  814:                    end},
  815:          #{desc => "recv (1)",
  816:            cmd  => fun(#{csock := Sock,
  817:                          recv  := Recv} = State) ->
  818:                            case Recv(Sock) of
  819:                                {ok, Data} ->
  820:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv ~p bytes", [size(Data)]),
  821:                                    {ok, State#{read_pkg  => 1,
  822:                                                read_byte => size(Data)}};
  823:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
  824:                                    ERROR
  825:                            end
  826:                    end},
  827:          #{desc => "validate (recv 1)",
  828:            cmd  => fun(#{csock     := Sock,
  829:                          read_pkg  := Pkg,
  830:                          read_byte := Byte} = _State) ->
  831:                            try socket:info(Sock) of
  832:                                #{counters := Counters} ->
  833:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("validate counters: "
  834:                                                "~s", [format_counters(Counters)]),
  835:                                    traffic_sar_counters_validation(
  836:                                      Counters,
  837:                                      [{read_pkg,     Pkg},
  838:                                       {read_byte,    Byte},
  839:                                       {read_tries,   any},
  840:                                       {read_pkg_max, any}])
  841:                            catch
  842:                                C:E:S ->
  843:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed get socket info: "
  844:                                                "~n   Class: ~p"
  845:                                                "~n   Error: ~p"
  846:                                                "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),
  847:                                    {error, {socket_info_failed, {C, E, S}}}
  848:                            end
  849:                    end},
  850:          #{desc => "announce ready (recv_and_validate 1)",
  851:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
  852:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv_and_validate),
  853:                            ok
  854:                    end},
  855: 
  856:          #{desc => "await continue (send_and_validate 1)",
  857:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
  858:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, send_and_validate)
  859:                    end},
  860:          #{desc => "send (1)",
  861:            cmd  => fun(#{csock := Sock,
  862:                          send  := Send} = State) ->
  863:                            Data = ?DATA,
  864:                            case Send(Sock, Data) of
  865:                                ok ->
  866:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("sent ~p bytes", [size(Data)]),
  867:                                    {ok, State#{write_pkg  => 1,
  868:                                                write_byte => size(Data)}};
  869:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
  870:                                    ERROR
  871:                            end
  872:                    end},
  873:          #{desc => "validate (send 1)",
  874:            cmd  => fun(#{csock      := Sock,
  875:                          read_pkg   := RPkg,
  876:                          read_byte  := RByte,
  877:                          write_pkg  := SPkg,
  878:                          write_byte := SByte} = _State) ->
  879:                            try socket:info(Sock) of
  880:                                #{counters := Counters} ->
  881:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("validate counters: "
  882:                                                "~s", [format_counters(Counters)]),
  883:                                    traffic_sar_counters_validation(
  884:                                      Counters,
  885:                                      [{read_pkg,      RPkg},
  886:                                       {read_byte,     RByte},
  887:                                       {write_pkg,     SPkg},
  888:                                       {write_byte,    SByte},
  889:                                       {read_tries,    any},
  890:                                       {write_tries,   any},
  891:                                       {read_pkg_max,  any},
  892:                                       {write_pkg_max, any}])
  893:                            catch
  894:                                C:E:S ->
  895:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed get socket info: "
  896:                                                "~n   Class: ~p"
  897:                                                "~n   Error: ~p"
  898:                                                "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),
  899:                                    {error, {socket_info_failed, {C, E, S}}}
  900:                            end
  901:                    end},
  902:          #{desc => "announce ready (send_and_validate 1)",
  903:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
  904:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, send_and_validate),
  905:                            ok
  906:                    end},
  907: 
  908:          #{desc => "await continue (recv_and_validate 2)",
  909:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
  910:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, recv_and_validate)
  911:                    end},
  912:          #{desc => "recv (2)",
  913:            cmd  => fun(#{csock     := Sock,
  914:                          recv      := Recv,
  915:                          read_pkg  := Pkg,
  916:                          read_byte := Byte} = State) ->
  917:                            case Recv(Sock) of
  918:                                {ok, Data} ->
  919:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv ~p bytes", [size(Data)]),
  920:                                    {ok, State#{read_pkg  => Pkg + 1,
  921:                                                read_byte => Byte + size(Data)}};
  922:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
  923:                                    ERROR
  924:                            end
  925:                    end},
  926:          #{desc => "validate (recv 2)",
  927:            cmd  => fun(#{csock      := Sock,
  928:                          read_pkg   := RPkg,
  929:                          read_byte  := RByte,
  930:                          write_pkg  := SPkg,
  931:                          write_byte := SByte} = _State) ->
  932:                            try socket:info(Sock) of
  933:                                #{counters := Counters} ->
  934:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("validate counters: "
  935:                                                "~s", [format_counters(Counters)]),
  936:                                    traffic_sar_counters_validation(
  937:                                      Counters,
  938:                                      [{read_pkg,      RPkg},
  939:                                       {read_byte,     RByte},
  940:                                       {write_pkg,     SPkg},
  941:                                       {write_byte,    SByte},
  942:                                       {read_tries,    any},
  943:                                       {write_tries,   any},
  944:                                       {read_pkg_max,  any},
  945:                                       {write_pkg_max, any}])
  946:                            catch
  947:                                C:E:S ->
  948:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed get socket info: "
  949:                                                "~n   Class: ~p"
  950:                                                "~n   Error: ~p"
  951:                                                "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),
  952:                                    {error, {socket_info_failed, {C, E, S}}}
  953:                            end
  954:                    end},
  955:          #{desc => "announce ready (recv_and_validate 2)",
  956:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
  957:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv_and_validate),
  958:                            ok
  959:                    end},
  960: 
  961:          #{desc => "await continue (send_and_validate 2)",
  962:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
  963:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, send_and_validate)
  964:                    end},
  965:          #{desc => "send (2)",
  966:            cmd  => fun(#{csock      := Sock,
  967:                          send       := Send,
  968:                          write_pkg  := Pkg,
  969:                          write_byte := Byte} = State) ->
  970:                            Data = ?DATA,
  971:                            case Send(Sock, Data) of
  972:                                ok ->
  973:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("sent ~p bytes", [size(Data)]),
  974:                                    {ok, State#{write_pkg  => Pkg + 1,
  975:                                                write_byte => Byte + size(Data)}};
  976:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
  977:                                    ERROR
  978:                            end
  979:                    end},
  980:          #{desc => "validate (send 2)",
  981:            cmd  => fun(#{csock      := Sock,
  982:                          read_pkg   := RPkg,
  983:                          read_byte  := RByte,
  984:                          write_pkg  := SPkg,
  985:                          write_byte := SByte} = _State) ->
  986:                            try socket:info(Sock) of
  987:                                #{counters := Counters} ->
  988:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("validate counters: "
  989:                                                "~s", [format_counters(Counters)]),
  990:                                    traffic_sar_counters_validation(
  991:                                      Counters,
  992:                                      [{read_pkg,      RPkg},
  993:                                       {read_byte,     RByte},
  994:                                       {write_pkg,     SPkg},
  995:                                       {write_byte,    SByte},
  996:                                       {read_tries,    any},
  997:                                       {write_tries,   any},
  998:                                       {read_pkg_max,  any},
  999:                                       {write_pkg_max, any}])
 1000:                            catch
 1001:                                C:E:S ->
 1002:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed get socket info: "
 1003:                                                "~n   Class: ~p"
 1004:                                                "~n   Error: ~p"
 1005:                                                "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),

 1531:                    end},
 1532:          #{desc => "await server termination",
 1533:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = State) ->
 1534:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Server),
 1535:                            State1 = maps:remove(server, State),
 1536:                            {ok, State1}
 1537:                    end},
 1538: 
 1539:          %% *** We are done ***
 1540:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 1541:         ],
 1542: 
 1543:     i("start server evaluator"),
 1544:     ServerInitState = InitState#{host => local_host()},
 1545:     Server = ?SEV_START("server", ServerSeq, ServerInitState),
 1546: 
 1547:     i("start client evaluator(s)"),
 1548:     ClientInitState = InitState#{host => local_host()},
 1549:     Client = ?SEV_START("client", ClientSeq, ClientInitState),
 1550: 
 1551:     i("start 'tester' evaluator"),
 1552:     TesterInitState = #{server => Server#ev.pid,
 1553:                         client => Client#ev.pid},
 1554:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 1555: 
 1556:     i("await evaluator"),
 1557:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Server, Client, Tester]).
 1558: 
 1559: 
 1560: format_counters(Counters) ->
 1561:     format_counters(traffic, Counters).
 1562: 
 1563: format_counters(Type, Counters) when (Type =:= listen) orelse (Type =:= traffic) ->
 1564:     format_counters("   ", Type, Counters).
 1565: 
 1566: format_counters(Prefix, traffic, Counters) ->
 1567:     ReadByte    = maps:get(read_byte,     Counters, -1),
 1568:     ReadFails   = maps:get(read_fails,    Counters, -1),
 1569:     ReadPkg     = maps:get(read_pkg,      Counters, -1),
 1570:     ReadPkgMax  = maps:get(read_pkg_max,  Counters, -1),
 1571:     ReadTries   = maps:get(read_tries,    Counters, -1),
 1572:     ReadWaits   = maps:get(read_waits,    Counters, -1),
 1573:     WriteByte   = maps:get(write_byte,    Counters, -1),
 1574:     WriteFails  = maps:get(write_fails,   Counters, -1),
 1575:     WritePkg    = maps:get(write_pkg,     Counters, -1),
 1576:     WritePkgMax = maps:get(write_pkg_max, Counters, -1),
 1577:     WriteTries  = maps:get(write_tries,   Counters, -1),
 1578:     WriteWaits  = maps:get(write_waits,   Counters, -1),
 1579:     ?F("~n~sNumber Of Read Bytes:     ~p"
 1580:        "~n~sNumber Of Read Fails:     ~p"
 1581:        "~n~sNumber Of Read Packages:  ~p"
 1582:        "~n~sNumber Of Read Tries:     ~p"
 1583:        "~n~sNumber Of Read Waits:     ~p"
 1584:        "~n~sMax Read Package Size:    ~p"
 1585:        "~n~sNumber Of Write Bytes:    ~p"
 1586:        "~n~sNumber Of Write Fails:    ~p"
 1587:        "~n~sNumber Of Write Packages: ~p"
 1588:        "~n~sNumber Of Write Tries:    ~p"
 1589:        "~n~sNumber Of Write Waits:    ~p"
 1590:        "~n~sMax Write Package Size:   ~p",
 1591:        [Prefix, ReadByte,
 1592:         Prefix, ReadFails,
 1593:         Prefix, ReadPkg,
 1594:         Prefix, ReadTries,
 1595:         Prefix, ReadWaits,
 1596:         Prefix, ReadPkgMax,
 1597:         Prefix, WriteByte,
 1598:         Prefix, WriteFails,
 1599:         Prefix, WritePkg,
 1600:         Prefix, WriteTries,
 1601:         Prefix, WriteWaits,
 1602:         Prefix, WritePkgMax]);
 1603: 
 1604: format_counters(Prefix, listen, Counters) ->
 1605:     AccSuccess = maps:get(acc_success, Counters, -1),
 1606:     AccFails   = maps:get(acc_fails,   Counters, -1),
 1607:     AccTries   = maps:get(acc_tries,   Counters, -1),
 1608:     AccWaits   = maps:get(acc_waits,   Counters, -1),
 1609:     ?F("~n~sNumber Of Successful Accepts: ~p"
 1610:        "~n~sNumber Of Failed Accepts:     ~p"
 1611:        "~n~sNumber Of Accept Attempts:    ~p"
 1612:        "~n~sNumber Of Accept Waits:       ~p",
 1613:        [Prefix, AccSuccess,
 1614:         Prefix, AccFails,
 1615:         Prefix, AccTries,
 1616:         Prefix, AccWaits]).
 1617: 
 1618: all_counters() ->
 1619:     [
 1620:      read_byte,
 1621:      read_fails,
 1622:      read_pkg,
 1623:      read_pkg_max,
 1624:      read_tries,
 1625:      read_waits,
 1626:      write_byte,
 1627:      write_fails,
 1628:      write_pkg,
 1629:      write_pkg_max,
 1630:      write_tries,
 1631:      write_waits,
 1632:      acc_success,
 1633:      acc_fails,
 1634:      acc_tries,
 1635:      acc_waits
 1636:     ].
 1637: 
 1638: zero_counters() ->
 1639:     [{Cnt, 0} || Cnt <- all_counters()].
 1640: 
 1641: any_counters() ->
 1642:     [{Cnt, any} || Cnt <- all_counters()].
 1643: 
 1644: 
 1645: %% This function ensures that we have a list of "validate counters"
 1646: %% that have an entry for each existing counter.
 1647: 
 1648: ensure_counters(Counters) ->
 1649:     ensure_counters(any_counters(), Counters, []).
 1650: 
 1651: ensure_counters([], [], Acc) ->
 1652:     lists:reverse(Acc);
 1653: ensure_counters([{Cnt, Val}|DefCounters], Counters, Acc) ->
 1654:     case lists:keysearch(Cnt, 1, Counters) of
 1655:         {value, {Cnt, _} = T} ->
 1656:             Counters2 = lists:keydelete(Cnt, 1, Counters),
 1657:             ensure_counters(DefCounters, Counters2, [T|Acc]);
 1658:         false ->
 1659:             ensure_counters(DefCounters, Counters, [{Cnt, Val}|Acc])
 1660:     end.
 1661: 
 1662: traffic_sar_counters_validation(Counters) ->
 1663:     %% ?SEV_IPRINT("traffic_sar_counters_validation -> entry with"
 1664:     %%             "~n   Counters: ~p", [Counters]),
 1665:     traffic_sar_counters_validation2(maps:to_list(Counters),
 1666:                                      zero_counters()).
 1667: 
 1668: traffic_sar_counters_validation(Counters, ValidateCounters) ->
 1669:     %% ?SEV_IPRINT("traffic_sar_counters_validation -> entry with"
 1670:     %%             "~n   Counters:          ~p"
 1671:     %%             "~n   Validate Counters: ~p", [Counters, ValidateCounters]),
 1672:     traffic_sar_counters_validation2(maps:to_list(Counters),
 1673:                                      ensure_counters(ValidateCounters)).
 1674: 
 1675: traffic_sar_counters_validation2(Counters, []) ->
 1676:     %% ?SEV_IPRINT("traffic_sar_counters_validation2 -> Remaining Counters: "
 1677:     %%             "~n   ~p", [Counters]),
 1678:     (catch lists:foreach(
 1679:              fun({_Cnt, 0})   -> ok;
 1680:                 ({Cnt,  Val}) ->
 1681:                      throw({error, {invalid_counter, Cnt, Val}})
 1682:              end,
 1683:              Counters));
 1684: traffic_sar_counters_validation2(Counters, [{Cnt, Val}|ValidateCounters]) ->
 1685:     %% ?SEV_IPRINT("traffic_sar_counters_validation2 -> try validate ~w when"
 1686:     %%             "~n   Counters:         ~p"
 1687:     %%             "~n   ValidateCounters: ~p", [Cnt, Counters, ValidateCounters]),
 1688:     case lists:keysearch(Cnt, 1, Counters) of
 1689:         {value, {Cnt, Val}} ->
 1690:             %% ?SEV_IPRINT("traffic_sar_counters_validation2 -> ~w validated", [Cnt]),
 1691:             Counters2 = lists:keydelete(Cnt, 1, Counters),
 1692:             traffic_sar_counters_validation2(Counters2, ValidateCounters);
 1693:         {value, {Cnt, _Val}} when (Val =:= any) ->
 1694:             %% ?SEV_IPRINT("traffic_sar_counters_validation2 -> "
 1695:             %%             "~w validated (any) when"
 1696:             %%             "~n   Counters: ~p", [Cnt, Counters]),
 1697:             Counters2 = lists:keydelete(Cnt, 1, Counters),
 1698:             traffic_sar_counters_validation2(Counters2, ValidateCounters);
 1699:         {value, {Cnt, InvVal}} ->
 1700:             ?SEV_EPRINT("traffic_sar_counters_validation2 -> "
 1701:                         "~w validation failed: "
 1702:                         "~n   Expected Value: ~p"
 1703:                         "~n   Actual Value:   ~p", [Cnt, Val, InvVal]),
 1704:             {error, {invalid_counter, Cnt, InvVal, Val}};
 1705:         false ->
 1706:             ?SEV_EPRINT("traffic_sar_counters_validation2 -> "
 1707:                         "~w validation failed: Unknown", [Cnt]),
 1708:             {error, {unknown_counter, Cnt, Counters}}
 1709:     end.
 1710:

 1719: traffic_sendto_and_recvfrom_counters_udp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 1720:     ?TT(?SECS(15)),
 1721:     tc_try(traffic_sendto_and_recvfrom_counters_udp4,
 1722:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
 1723:            fun() ->
 1724:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
 1725:                                  proto  => udp,
 1726:                                  recv   => fun(S) ->
 1727:                                                    socket:recvfrom(S)
 1728:                                            end,
 1729:                                  send   => fun(S, Data, Dest) ->
 1730:                                                    socket:sendto(S, Data, Dest)
 1731:                                            end},
 1732:                    ok = traffic_send_and_recv_udp(InitState)
 1733:            end).

 1786: %% This test case is intended to (simply) test the counters

 1789: %% We use UDP on IPv4.

 1791: traffic_sendmsg_and_recvmsg_counters_udp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->

 1804:                                                            ERROR

 1808:                                                    Msg = #{addr => Dest,
 1809:                                                               iov  => [Data]},
 1810:                                                    socket:sendmsg(S, Msg)
 1811:                                            end},

 1880: 
 1881: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1882: 
 1883: traffic_send_and_recv_udp(InitState) ->
 1884:     ServerSeq =
 1885:         [
 1886:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 1887:          #{desc => "await start",
 1888:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 1889:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 1890:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 1891:                    end},
 1892:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 1893:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 1894:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 1895:                            ok
 1896:                    end},
 1897: 
 1898:          %% *** Init part ***
 1899:          #{desc => "which local address",
 1900:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
 1901:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
 1902:                            {ok, State#{local_sa => LSA}}
 1903:                    end},
 1904:          #{desc => "create socket",
 1905:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain, proto := Proto} = State) ->
 1906:                            case socket:open(Domain, dgram, Proto) of
 1907:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 1908:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 1909:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1910:                                    ERROR
 1911:                            end
 1912:                    end},
 1913:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
 1914:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
 1915:                          sock     := Sock,
 1916:                          local_sa := LSA} = _State) ->
 1917:                            case socket:bind(Sock, LSA) of
 1918:                                ok ->
 1919:                                    ok; % We do not care about the port for local
 1920:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1921:                                    ERROR
 1922:                            end;
 1923:                       (#{sock     := LSock,
 1924:                          local_sa := LSA} = State) ->
 1925:                            case sock_bind(LSock, LSA) of
 1926:                                ok ->
 1927:                                    Port = sock_port(LSock),
 1928:                                    {ok, State#{lport => Port}};
 1929:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1930:                                    ERROR
 1931:                            end
 1932:                    end},
 1933:          #{desc => "initial counter validation (=zero)",
 1934:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1935:                            try socket:info(Sock) of
 1936:                                #{counters := Counters} ->
 1937:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Validate initial counters: "
 1938:                                                "~s", [format_counters(Counters)]),
 1939:                                    traffic_sar_counters_validation(Counters)
 1940:                            catch
 1941:                                C:E:S ->
 1942:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed get socket info: "
 1943:                                                "~n   Class: ~p"
 1944:                                                "~n   Error: ~p"
 1945:                                                "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),
 1946:                                    {error, {socket_info_failed, {C, E, S}}}
 1947:                            end
 1948:                    end},
 1949:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 1950:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
 1951:                          tester   := Tester,
 1952:                          local_sa := #{path := Path}}) ->
 1953:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Path),
 1954:                            ok;
 1955:                       (#{tester   := Tester,
 1956:                          lport    := Port}) ->
 1957:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Port),
 1958:                            ok
 1959:                    end},
 1960: 
 1961:          %% The actual test
 1962:          #{desc => "await continue (recv_and_validate 1)",
 1963:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 1964:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, recv_and_validate)
 1965:                    end},
 1966:          #{desc => "recv (1)",
 1967:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock,
 1968:                          recv := Recv} = State) ->
 1969:                            case Recv(Sock) of
 1970:                                {ok, {ClientSA, Data}} ->
 1971:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv ~p bytes", [size(Data)]),
 1972:                                    {ok, State#{client_sa => ClientSA,
 1973:                                                read_pkg  => 1,
 1974:                                                read_byte => size(Data)}};
 1975:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1976:                                    ERROR
 1977:                            end
 1978:                    end},
 1979:          #{desc => "validate (recv 1)",
 1980:            cmd  => fun(#{sock      := Sock,
 1981:                          read_pkg  := Pkg,
 1982:                          read_byte := Byte} = _State) ->
 1983:                            try socket:info(Sock) of
 1984:                                #{counters := Counters} ->
 1985:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("validate counters: "
 1986:                                                "~s", [format_counters(Counters)]),
 1987:                                    traffic_sar_counters_validation(
 1988:                                      Counters,
 1989:                                      [{read_pkg,   Pkg},
 1990:                                       {read_byte,  Byte},
 1991:                                       {read_tries, any}])
 1992:                            catch
 1993:                                C:E:S ->
 1994:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed get socket info: "
 1995:                                                "~n   Class: ~p"
 1996:                                                "~n   Error: ~p"
 1997:                                                "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),
 1998:                                    {error, {socket_info_failed, {C, E, S}}}
 1999:                            end
 2000:                    end},
 2001:          #{desc => "announce ready (recv_and_validate 1)",
 2002:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 2003:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv_and_validate),
 2004:                            ok
 2005:                    end},
 2006: 
 2007:          #{desc => "await continue (send_and_validate 1)",
 2008:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 2009:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, send_and_validate)
 2010:                    end},
 2011:          #{desc => "send (1)",
 2012:            cmd  => fun(#{sock      := Sock,
 2013:                          send      := Send,
 2014:                          client_sa := ClientSA} = State) ->
 2015:                            Data = ?DATA,
 2016:                            case Send(Sock, Data, ClientSA) of
 2017:                                ok ->
 2018:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("sent ~p bytes", [size(Data)]),
 2019:                                    {ok, State#{write_pkg  => 1,
 2020:                                                write_byte => size(Data)}};
 2021:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2022:                                    ERROR
 2023:                            end
 2024:                    end},
 2025:          #{desc => "validate (send 1)",
 2026:            cmd  => fun(#{sock       := Sock,
 2027:                          read_pkg   := RPkg,
 2028:                          read_byte  := RByte,
 2029:                          write_pkg  := SPkg,
 2030:                          write_byte := SByte} = _State) ->
 2031:                            try socket:info(Sock) of
 2032:                                #{counters := Counters} ->
 2033:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("validate counters: "
 2034:                                                "~s", [format_counters(Counters)]),
 2035:                                    traffic_sar_counters_validation(
 2036:                                      Counters,
 2037:                                      [{read_pkg,    RPkg},
 2038:                                       {read_byte,   RByte},
 2039:                                       {write_pkg,   SPkg},
 2040:                                       {write_byte,  SByte},
 2041:                                       {read_tries,  any},
 2042:                                       {write_tries, any}])
 2043:                            catch
 2044:                                C:E:S ->
 2045:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed get socket info: "
 2046:                                                "~n   Class: ~p"
 2047:                                                "~n   Error: ~p"
 2048:                                                "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),
 2049:                                    {error, {socket_info_failed, {C, E, S}}}
 2050:                            end
 2051:                    end},
 2052:          #{desc => "announce ready (send_and_validate 1)",
 2053:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 2054:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, send_and_validate),
 2055:                            ok
 2056:                    end},
 2057: 
 2058:          #{desc => "await continue (recv_and_validate 2)",
 2059:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 2060:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, recv_and_validate)
 2061:                    end},
 2062:          #{desc => "recv (2)",
 2063:            cmd  => fun(#{sock      := Sock,
 2064:                          recv      := Recv,
 2065:                          read_pkg  := Pkg,
 2066:                          read_byte := Byte} = State) ->
 2067:                            case Recv(Sock) of
 2068:                                {ok, {Source, Data}} ->
 2069:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv ~p bytes", [size(Data)]),
 2070:                                    {ok, State#{client_sa => Source,
 2071:                                                read_pkg  => Pkg + 1,
 2072:                                                read_byte => Byte + size(Data)}};
 2073:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2074:                                    ERROR
 2075:                            end
 2076:                    end},
 2077:          #{desc => "validate (recv 2)",
 2078:            cmd  => fun(#{sock       := Sock,
 2079:                          read_pkg   := RPkg,
 2080:                          read_byte  := RByte,
 2081:                          write_pkg  := SPkg,
 2082:                          write_byte := SByte} = _State) ->
 2083:                            try socket:info(Sock) of

 2593:          #{desc => "await server ready (recv_and_validate 1)",
 2594:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
 2595:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, recv_and_validate)
 2596:                    end},
 2597: 
 2598:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 2599: 
 2600:          #{desc => "order client to continue (recv_and_validate 1)",
 2601:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
 2602:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, recv_and_validate),
 2603:                            ok
 2604:                    end},
 2605:          #{desc => "order server to continue (send_and_validate 1)",
 2606:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
 2607:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Server, send_and_validate),
 2608:                            ok
 2609:                    end},
 2610:          #{desc => "await server ready (send_and_validate 1)",
 2611:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
 2612:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, send_and_validate)
 2613:                    end},
 2614:          #{desc => "await client ready (recv_and_validate 1)",
 2615:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
 2616:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, recv_and_validate)
 2617:                    end},
 2618: 
 2619:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 2620: 
 2621:          #{desc => "order server to continue (recv_and_validate 2)",
 2622:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
 2623:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Server, recv_and_validate),
 2624:                            ok
 2625:                    end},
 2626:          #{desc => "order client to continue (send_and_validate 2)",
 2627:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
 2628:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, send_and_validate),
 2629:                            ok
 2630:                    end},
 2631:          #{desc => "await client ready (send_and_validate 2)",
 2632:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
 2633:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, send_and_validate)
 2634:                    end},
 2635:          #{desc => "await server ready (recv_and_validate 2)",
 2636:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
 2637:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, recv_and_validate)
 2638:                    end},
 2639: 
 2640:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 2641: 
 2642:          #{desc => "order client to continue (recv_and_validate 2)",
 2643:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
 2644:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, recv_and_validate),
 2645:                            ok
 2646:                    end},
 2647:          #{desc => "order server to continue (send_and_validate 2)",
 2648:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
 2649:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Server, send_and_validate),
 2650:                            ok
 2651:                    end},
 2652:          #{desc => "await server ready (send_and_validate 2)",
 2653:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
 2654:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, send_and_validate)
 2655:                    end},
 2656:          #{desc => "await client ready (recv_and_validate 2)",
 2657:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
 2658:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, recv_and_validate)
 2659:                    end},
 2660: 
 2661:          %% *** Termination ***
 2662:          #{desc => "order client to terminate",
 2663:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
 2664:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Client),
 2665:                            ok
 2666:                    end},
 2667:          #{desc => "await client termination",
 2668:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = State) ->
 2669:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Client),
 2670:                            State1 = maps:remove(client, State),
 2671:                            {ok, State1}
 2672:                    end},
 2673:          #{desc => "order server to terminate",
 2674:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
 2675:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Server),
 2676:                            ok
 2677:                    end},
 2678:          #{desc => "await server termination",
 2679:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = State) ->
 2680:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Server),
 2681:                            State1 = maps:remove(server, State),
 2682:                            {ok, State1}
 2683:                    end},
 2684: 
 2685:          %% *** We are done ***
 2686:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 2687:         ],
 2688: 
 2689:     i("start server evaluator"),
 2690:     ServerInitState = InitState#{host => local_host()},
 2691:     Server = ?SEV_START("server", ServerSeq, ServerInitState),
 2692: 
 2693:     i("start client evaluator(s)"),
 2694:     ClientInitState = InitState#{host => local_host()},
 2695:     Client = ?SEV_START("client", ClientSeq, ClientInitState),
 2696: 
 2697:     i("start 'tester' evaluator"),
 2698:     TesterInitState = #{server => Server#ev.pid,
 2699:                         client => Client#ev.pid},
 2700:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 2701: 
 2702:     i("await evaluator"),
 2703:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Server, Client, Tester]).

 2713: %% Protocol is tcp and Domain is IPv4.

 2718:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
 2719:            fun() ->
 2720:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
 2721:                                  proto  => tcp},
 2722:                    ok = traffic_send_and_recv_chunks_stream(InitState)

 2808: 
 2809: traffic_send_and_recv_chunks_stream(InitState) ->
 2810:     ServerSeq =
 2811:         [
 2812:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 2813:          #{desc => "await start",
 2814:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 2815:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 2816:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 2817:                    end},
 2818:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 2819:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 2820:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 2821:                            ok
 2822:                    end},
 2823: 
 2824:          %% *** Init part ***
 2825:          #{desc => "which local address",
 2826:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
 2827:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
 2828:                            {ok, State#{local_sa => LSA}}
 2829:                    end},
 2830:          #{desc => "create listen socket",
 2831:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain, proto := Proto} = State) ->
 2832:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
 2833:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 2834:                                    {ok, State#{lsock => Sock}};
 2835:                                {error, eprotonosupport = Reason} ->
 2836:                                    {skip, Reason};
 2837:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2838:                                    ERROR
 2839:                            end
 2840:                    end},
 2841:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
 2842:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
 2843:                          lsock    := LSock,
 2844:                          local_sa := LSA} = _State) ->
 2845:                            case socket:bind(LSock, LSA) of
 2846:                                ok ->
 2847:                                    ok; % We do not care about the port for local
 2848:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2849:                                    ERROR
 2850:                            end;
 2851:                       (#{lsock    := LSock,
 2852:                          local_sa := LSA} = State) ->
 2853:                            case sock_bind(LSock, LSA) of
 2854:                                ok ->
 2855:                                    Port = sock_port(LSock),
 2856:                                    {ok, State#{lport => Port}};
 2857:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2858:                                    ERROR
 2859:                            end
 2860:                    end},
 2861:          #{desc => "make listen socket",
 2862:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock}) ->
 2863:                            socket:listen(LSock)
 2864:                    end},
 2865:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 2866:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
 2867:                          tester   := Tester,
 2868:                          local_sa := LSA}) ->
 2869:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, LSA),
 2870:                            ok;
 2871:                       (#{tester   := Tester,
 2872:                          local_sa := LSA,
 2873:                          lport    := Port}) ->
 2874:                            ServerSA = LSA#{port => Port},
 2875:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, ServerSA),
 2876:                            ok
 2877:                    end},
 2878: 
 2879:          %% The actual test
 2880:          #{desc => "await continue (accept)",
 2881:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 2882:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, accept)
 2883:                    end},
 2884:          #{desc => "accept",
 2885:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock} = State) ->
 2886:                            case socket:accept(LSock) of
 2887:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 2888:                                    {ok, State#{csock => Sock}};
 2889:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2890:                                    ERROR
 2891:                            end
 2892:                    end},
 2893:          #{desc => "announce ready (accept)",
 2894:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 2895:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, accept),
 2896:                            ok
 2897:                    end},
 2898: 
 2899:          #{desc => "await continue (recv-many-small)",
 2900:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 2901:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, recv_many_small)
 2902:                    end},
 2903:          #{desc => "recv chunk 1",
 2904:            cmd  => fun(#{csock := Sock} = State) ->
 2905:                            case socket:recv(Sock, 100) of
 2906:                                {ok, Chunk} ->
 2907:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv of chunk 1 of ~p bytes",
 2908:                                                [size(Chunk)]),
 2909:                                    {ok, State#{chunks => [b2l(Chunk)]}};
 2910:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2911:                                    ERROR
 2912:                            end
 2913:                    end},
 2914:          #{desc => "recv chunk 2",
 2915:            cmd  => fun(#{csock  := Sock,
 2916:                          chunks := Chunks} = State) ->
 2917:                            case socket:recv(Sock, 100) of
 2918:                                {ok, Chunk} ->
 2919:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv of chunk 2 of ~p bytes",
 2920:                                                [size(Chunk)]),
 2921:                                    {ok, State#{chunks => [b2l(Chunk)|Chunks]}};
 2922:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2923:                                    ERROR
 2924:                            end
 2925:                    end},
 2926:          #{desc => "recv chunk 3",
 2927:            cmd  => fun(#{csock  := Sock,
 2928:                          chunks := Chunks} = State) ->
 2929:                            case socket:recv(Sock, 100) of
 2930:                                {ok, Chunk} ->
 2931:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv of chunk 3 of ~p bytes",
 2932:                                                [size(Chunk)]),
 2933:                                    {ok, State#{chunks => [b2l(Chunk)|Chunks]}};
 2934:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2935:                                    ERROR
 2936:                            end
 2937:                    end},
 2938:          #{desc => "recv chunk 4",
 2939:            cmd  => fun(#{csock  := Sock,
 2940:                          chunks := Chunks} = State) ->
 2941:                            case socket:recv(Sock, 100) of
 2942:                                {ok, Chunk} ->
 2943:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv of chunk 4 of ~p bytes",
 2944:                                                [size(Chunk)]),
 2945:                                    {ok, State#{chunks => [b2l(Chunk)|Chunks]}};
 2946:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2947:                                    ERROR
 2948:                            end
 2949:                    end},
 2950:          #{desc => "recv chunk 5",
 2951:            cmd  => fun(#{csock  := Sock,
 2952:                          chunks := Chunks} = State) ->
 2953:                            case socket:recv(Sock, 100) of
 2954:                                {ok, Chunk} ->
 2955:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv of chunk 5 of ~p bytes",
 2956:                                                [size(Chunk)]),
 2957:                                    {ok, State#{chunks => [b2l(Chunk)|Chunks]}};
 2958:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2959:                                    ERROR
 2960:                            end
 2961:                    end},
 2962:          #{desc => "recv chunk 6",
 2963:            cmd  => fun(#{csock  := Sock,
 2964:                          chunks := Chunks} = State) ->
 2965:                            case socket:recv(Sock, 100) of
 2966:                                {ok, Chunk} ->
 2967:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv of chunk 6 of ~p bytes",
 2968:                                                [size(Chunk)]),
 2969:                                    {ok, State#{chunks => [b2l(Chunk)|Chunks]}};
 2970:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2971:                                    ERROR
 2972:                            end
 2973:                    end},
 2974:          #{desc => "recv chunk 7",
 2975:            cmd  => fun(#{csock  := Sock,
 2976:                          chunks := Chunks} = State) ->
 2977:                            case socket:recv(Sock, 100) of
 2978:                                {ok, Chunk} ->
 2979:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv of chunk 7 of ~p bytes",
 2980:                                                [size(Chunk)]),
 2981:                                    {ok, State#{chunks => [b2l(Chunk)|Chunks]}};
 2982:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2983:                                    ERROR
 2984:                            end
 2985:                    end},
 2986:          #{desc => "recv chunk 8",
 2987:            cmd  => fun(#{csock  := Sock,
 2988:                          chunks := Chunks} = State) ->
 2989:                            case socket:recv(Sock, 100) of
 2990:                                {ok, Chunk} ->
 2991:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv of chunk 8 of ~p bytes",
 2992:                                                [size(Chunk)]),
 2993:                                    {ok, State#{chunks => [b2l(Chunk)|Chunks]}};
 2994:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2995:                                    ERROR
 2996:                            end
 2997:                    end},
 2998:          #{desc => "recv chunk 9",
 2999:            cmd  => fun(#{csock  := Sock,
 3000:                          chunks := Chunks} = State) ->
 3001:                            case socket:recv(Sock, 100) of
 3002:                                {ok, Chunk} ->
 3003:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv of chunk 9 of ~p bytes",
 3004:                                                [size(Chunk)]),
 3005:                                    {ok, State#{chunks => [b2l(Chunk)|Chunks]}};
 3006:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 3007:                                    ERROR
 3008:                            end
 3009:                    end},
 3010:          #{desc => "recv chunk 10",
 3011:            cmd  => fun(#{csock  := Sock,
 3012:                          chunks := Chunks} = State) ->
 3013:                            case socket:recv(Sock, 100) of
 3014:                                {ok, Chunk} ->
 3015:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv of chunk 10 of ~p bytes",
 3016:                                                [size(Chunk)]),
 3017:                                    {ok, State#{chunks => [b2l(Chunk)|Chunks]}};
 3018:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 3019:                                    ERROR
 3020:                            end
 3021:                    end},
 3022:          #{desc => "announce ready (recv-many-small)",
 3023:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester,
 3024:                          chunks := Chunks} = State) ->
 3025:                            Data = lists:flatten(lists:reverse(Chunks)),
 3026:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv_many_small, Data),
 3027:                            {ok, maps:remove(chunks, State)}
 3028:                    end},
 3029: 
 3030:          #{desc => "await continue (recv-one-big)",
 3031:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 3032:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, recv_one_big) of
 3033:                                {ok, Size} ->
 3034:                                    {ok, State#{size => Size}};
 3035:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 3036:                                    ERROR
 3037:                            end
 3038:                    end},
 3039:          #{desc => "recv (one big)",
 3040:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, csock := Sock, size := Size} = _State) ->
 3041:                            %% socket:setopt(Sock, otp, debug, true),
 3042:                            case socket:recv(Sock, Size) of
 3043:                                {ok, Data} ->
 3044:                                    ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester,
 3045:                                                        recv_one_big,
 3046:                                                        b2l(Data)),
 3047:                                    ok;
 3048:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 3049:                                    ERROR
 3050:                            end
 3051:                    end},
 3052: 
 3053:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 3054:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 3055:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 3056:                                ok ->
 3057:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 3058:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 3059:                                    ERROR
 3060:                            end
 3061:                    end},
 3062:          #{desc => "close connection socket (just in case)",
 3063:            cmd  => fun(#{csock := Sock} = State) ->
 3064:                            (catch socket:close(Sock)),
 3065:                            {ok, maps:remove(csock, State)}
 3066:                    end},
 3067:          #{desc => "close listen socket",
 3068:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
 3069:                          lsock    := Sock,
 3070:                          local_sa := #{path := Path}} = State) ->
 3071:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 3072:                            State1 =
 3073:                                unlink_path(Path,
 3074:                                            fun() ->
 3075:                                                    maps:remove(local_sa, State)
 3076:                                            end,
 3077:                                            fun() -> State end),
 3078:                            {ok, maps:remove(lsock, State1)};
 3079:                       (#{lsock := Sock} = State) ->
 3080:                            (catch socket:close(Sock)),
 3081:                            {ok, maps:remove(lsock, State)}
 3082:                    end},
 3083: 
 3084:          %% *** We are done ***
 3085:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 3086:         ],
 3087: 
 3088:     ClientSeq =
 3089:         [
 3090:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 3091:          #{desc => "await start",
 3092:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 3093:                            {Tester, ServerSA} = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 3094:                            {ok, State#{tester    => Tester,
 3095:                                        server_sa => ServerSA}}
 3096:                    end},
 3097:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 3098:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 3099:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 3100:                            ok
 3101:                    end},
 3102: 
 3103:          %% *** Init part ***
 3104:          #{desc => "create node",
 3105:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 3106:                            {Peer, Node} = start_node("client"),
 3107:                            {ok, State#{peer => Peer, node => Node}}
 3108:                    end},
 3109:          #{desc => "monitor client node",
 3110:            cmd  => fun(#{node := Node} = _State) ->
 3111:                            true = erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
 3112:                            ok
 3113:                    end},
 3114:          #{desc => "start remote client",
 3115:            cmd  => fun(#{node := Node} = State) ->
 3116:                            Pid = traffic_snr_tcp_client_start(Node),
 3117:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("client ~p started", [Pid]),
 3118:                            {ok, State#{rclient => Pid}}
 3119:                    end},
 3120:          #{desc => "monitor remote client",
 3121:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := Pid}) ->
 3122:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 3123:                            ok
 3124:                    end},
 3125:          #{desc => "order remote client to start",
 3126:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient   := Client,
 3127:                          server_sa := ServerSA,
 3128:                          proto     := Proto}) ->
