 6347:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 6348:                            ok
 6349:                    end},
 6350:          #{desc => "order remote handler to start",
 6351:            cmd  => fun(#{handler   := Handler,
 6352:                          server_sa := ServerSA,
 6353:                          proto     := Proto,
 6354:                          buf_init  := BufInit,
 6355:                          send      := Send,
 6356:                          recv      := Recv}) ->
 6357:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Handler, 
 6358:                                                {ServerSA, Proto, BufInit,
 6359:                                                 Send, Recv}),
 6360:                            ok
 6361:                    end},
 6362:          #{desc => "await (remote) handler ready",
 6363:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
 6364:                          handler := Handler} = _State) ->
 6365:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Handler, handler, init, 
 6366:                                             [{tester, Tester}])
 6367:                    end},
 6368:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 6369:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 6370:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
 6371:                            ok
 6372:                    end},
 6373: 
 6374:          %% The actual test
 6375:          #{desc => "await continue (send)",
 6376:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
 6377:                          handler := Handler} = _State) ->
 6378:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, 
 6379:                                                send, 
 6380:                                                [{handler, Handler}])
 6381:                    end},
 6382:          #{desc => "order handler to continue (send)",
 6383:            cmd  => fun(#{handler := Handler,
 6384:                          msg     := Msg,
 6385:                          num     := Num} = State) ->
 6386:                            Data = {Msg, Num},
 6387:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Handler, send, Data),
 6388:                            {ok, maps:remove(data, State)}
 6389:                    end},
 6390:          #{desc => "await remote handler ready (send)",
 6391:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
 6392:                          handler := Handler} = State) ->
 6393:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Handler, handler, send, 
 6394:                                                  [{tester, Tester}]) of
 6395:                                {ok, Result} ->
 6396:                                    %% ?SEV_IPRINT("remote client result: "
 6397:                                    %%             "~n   ~p", [Result]),
 6398:                                    {ok, State#{result => Result}};
 6399:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6400:                                    ERROR
 6401:                            end
 6402:                    end},
 6403:          #{desc => "announce ready (send)",
 6404:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, result := Result} = State) ->
 6405:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, send, Result),
 6406:                            {ok, maps:remove(result, State)}
 6407:                    end},
 6408: 
 6409:          %% Termination
 6410:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 6411:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester, 
 6412:                          handler := Handler} = State) ->
 6413:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester,
 6414:                                                      [{handler, Handler}]) of
 6415:                                ok ->
 6416:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 6417:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6418:                                    ERROR
 6419:                            end
 6420:                    end},
 6421:          #{desc => "stop (remote) handler",
 6422:            cmd  => fun(#{handler := Handler}) ->
 6423:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Handler),
 6424:                            ok
 6425:                    end},
 6426:          #{desc => "await (remote) handler termination",
 6427:            cmd  => fun(#{handler := Handler} = State) ->
 6428:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Handler),
 6429:                            State1 = maps:remove(handler, State),
 6430:                            {ok, State1}
 6431:                    end},
 6432:          #{desc => "stop client node",
 6433:            cmd  => fun(#{peer := Peer} = State) ->
 6434:                            {ok,
 6435:                             try peer:stop(Peer) of
 6436:                                 ok ->
 6437:                                     State#{node_stop => ok};
 6438:                                 {error, Reason} ->
 6439:                                     ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected node stop result: "
 6440:                                                 "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
 6441:                                     State#{node_stop => error}
 6442:                             catch
 6443:                                 C:E:S ->
 6444:                                     ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected node stop result: "
 6445:                                                 "~n   Class: ~p"
 6446:                                                 "~n   Error: ~p"
 6447:                                                 "~n   Stack: ~p",[C, E, S]),
 6448:                                     State#{node_stop => error}
 6449:                             end}
 6450:                    end},
 6451:          #{desc => "await client node termination",
 6452:            cmd  => fun(#{node := Node} = State) ->
 6453:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("Success node stop - await nodedown"),
 6454:                            receive
 6455:                                {nodedown, Node} ->
 6456:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("nodedown received - cleanup"),
 6457:                                    State1 = maps:remove(node, State),
 6458:                                    {ok, State1}
 6459:                            end;
 6460:                       (#{node_stop := error} = State) ->
 6461:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("Failed node stop - cleanup"),
 6462:                            State1 = maps:remove(node, State),
 6463:                            {ok, State1}
 6464:                    end},
 6465: 
 6466:          %% *** We are done ***
 6467:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 6468:         ],
 6469: 
 6470:     TesterSeq =
 6471:         [
 6472:          %% *** Init part ***
 6473:          #{desc => "monitor server",
 6474:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
 6475:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 6476:                            ok
 6477:                    end},
 6478:          #{desc => "monitor client",
 6479:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 6480:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 6481:                            ok
 6482:                    end},
 6483: 
 6484:          %% Start the server
 6485:          #{desc => "order server start",
 6486:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
 6487:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 6488:                            ok
 6489:                    end},
 6490:          #{desc => "await server ready (init)",
 6491:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = State) ->
 6492:                            {ok, ServerSA} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, server, init),
 6493:                            {ok, State#{server_sa => ServerSA}}
 6494:                    end},
 6495: 
 6496:          %% Start the client
 6497:          #{desc => "order client start",
 6498:            cmd  => fun(#{client    := Pid, 
 6499:                          server_sa := ServerSA} = _State) ->
 6500:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, ServerSA),
 6501:                            ok
 6502:                    end},
 6503:          #{desc => "await client ready (init)",
 6504:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 6505:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client, init)
 6506:                    end},
 6507:  
 6508:          %% The actual test
 6509:          #{desc => "order server continue (recv)",
 6510:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
 6511:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, recv),
 6512:                            ok
 6513:                    end},
 6514:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 6515:          #{desc => "order client continue (send)",
 6516:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 6517:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, send),
 6518:                            ok
 6519:                    end},
 6520:          #{desc => "await client ready (send)",
 6521:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server,
 6522:                          client := Client} = State) ->
 6523:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, send, 
 6524:                                                  [{server, Server}]) of
 6525:                                {ok, {_, _, _, _} = Result} ->
 6526:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("client result: "
 6527:                                                "~n   ~p", [Result]),
 6528:                                    {ok, State#{client_result => Result}};
 6529:                                {ok, BadResult} ->
 6530:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("client result: "
 6531:                                                "~n   ~p", [BadResult]),
 6532:                                    {error, {invalid_client_result, BadResult}};
 6533:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6534:                                    ERROR
 6535:                            end
 6536:                    end},
 6537:          #{desc => "order server continue (close)",
 6538:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
 6539:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close),
 6540:                            ok
 6541:                    end},
 6542:          #{desc => "await server ready (close)",
 6543:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
 6544:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, server, close)
 6545:                    end},
 6546:          %% Because of the way we control the server, there is no real 
 6547:          %% point in collecting statistics from it (the time will include
 6548:          %% our communication with it).
 6549:          #{desc => "await server ready (recv)",
 6550:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server,
 6551:                          client := Client} = _State) ->
 6552:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, recv,
 6553:                                                  [{client, Client}]) of
 6554:                                {ok, _Result} ->
 6555:                                    ok;
 6556:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6557:                                    ERROR
 6558:                            end
 6559:                    end},
 6560:          #{desc => "present result",
 6561:            cmd  => fun(#{client_result := CRes,
 6562:                          num           := Num} = State) ->
 6563:                            {CSent, CReceived, CStart, CStop} = CRes,
 6564:                            CTime = tdiff(CStart, CStop),
 6565:                            if
 6566:                                (CTime =:= 0) ->
 6567:                                    {skip,
 6568:                                     ?F("Invalid exec time: ~w ", [CTime])};
 6569:                                true ->
 6570:                                    %% Note that the sizes we are counting is
 6571:                                    %% only the "data" part of the messages.
 6572:                                    %% There is also fixed header for each
 6573:                                    %% message, which of course is small for
 6574:                                    %% the large messages, but comparatively
 6575:                                    %% big for the small messages!
 6576:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT(
 6577:                                       "Results: ~w messages exchanged"
 6578:                                       "~n   Client: ~w msec"
 6579:                                       "~n      ~.2f msec/message (roundtrip)"
 6580:                                       "~n      ~.2f messages/msec (roundtrip)"
 6581:                                       "~n      ~w bytes/msec sent"
 6582:                                       "~n      ~w bytes/msec received",
 6583:                                       [Num,
 6584:                                        CTime,
 6585:                                        CTime / Num,
 6586:                                        Num / CTime,
 6587:                                        CSent div CTime,
 6588:                                        CReceived div CTime]),
 6589:                                    State1 = maps:remove(client_result, State),
 6590:                                    {ok, State1}
 6591:                            end
 6592:                    end},
 6593: 
 6594:          %% Terminations
 6595:          #{desc => "order client to terminate",
 6596:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 6597:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 6598:                            ok
 6599:                    end},
 6600:          #{desc => "await client termination",
 6601:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = State) ->
 6602:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 6603:                                ok ->
 6604:                                    State1 = maps:remove(client, State),
 6605:                                    {ok, State1};
 6606:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6607:                                    ERROR
 6608:                            end
 6609:                    end},
 6610:          #{desc => "order server to terminate",
 6611:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
 6612:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 6613:                            ok
 6614:                    end},
 6615:          #{desc => "await server termination",
 6616:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = State) ->
 6617:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 6618:                                ok ->
 6619:                                    State1 = maps:remove(server, State),
 6620:                                    {ok, State1};
 6621:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6622:                                    ERROR
 6623:                            end
 6624:                    end},
 6625: 
 6626: 
 6627:          %% *** We are done ***
 6628:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 6629:         ],
 6630: 
 6631: 
 6632:     i("start server evaluator"),
 6633:     ServerInitState = #{domain   => maps:get(domain,   InitState),
 6634:                         proto    => maps:get(proto,    InitState),
 6635:                         recv     => maps:get(recv,     InitState),
 6636:                         send     => maps:get(send,     InitState),
 6637:                         buf_init => maps:get(buf_init, InitState)},
 6638:     Server = ?SEV_START("server", ServerSeq, ServerInitState),
 6639: 
 6640:     i("start client evaluator(s)"),
 6641:     ClientInitState = InitState#{host => local_host()},
 6642:     Client = ?SEV_START("client", ClientSeq, ClientInitState),
 6643: 
 6644:     i("start 'tester' evaluator"),
 6645:     TesterInitState = #{server => Server#ev.pid,
 6646:                         client => Client#ev.pid,
 6647:                         num    => maps:get(num, InitState)},
 6648:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 6649: 
 6650:     i("await evaluator"),
 6651:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Server, Client, Tester]).
 6652: 
 6653: 
 6654: 
 6655: %% Server side handler process
 6656: %% We don't actually need a separate process for this socket, 
 6657: %% but we do it anyway to simplify the sequence.
 6658: tpp_udp_server_handler_create() ->
 6659:     Self = self(),
 6660:     erlang:spawn(fun() -> tpp_udp_server_handler(Self) end).
 6661: 
 6662: tpp_udp_server_handler(Parent) ->
 6663:     tpp_udp_server_handler_init(Parent),
 6664:     {Sock, Send, Recv} = tpp_udp_handler_await_start(Parent),
 6665:     tpp_udp_handler_announce_ready(Parent, init),
 6666:     tpp_udp_handler_await_continue(Parent, recv),
 6667:     Result = tpp_udp_server_handler_msg_exchange(Sock, Send, Recv),
 6668:     tpp_udp_handler_announce_ready(Parent, recv, Result),
 6669:     Reason = tpp_udp_handler_await_terminate(Parent),
 6670:     ?SEV_IPRINT("terminating"),
 6671:     exit(Reason).
 6672: 
 6673: tpp_udp_server_handler_init(Parent) ->
 6674:     put(sname, "shandler"),
 6675:     ?SEV_IPRINT("init"),
 6676:     _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Parent),
 6677:     ok.
 6678: 
 6679: tpp_udp_server_handler_msg_exchange(Sock, Send, Recv) ->
 6680:     tpp_udp_server_handler_msg_exchange_loop(Sock, Send, Recv,
 6681:                                              0, 0, 0, undefined).
 6682: 
 6683: tpp_udp_server_handler_msg_exchange_loop(Sock, Send, Recv, 
 6684:                                          N, Sent, Received, Start) ->
 6685:     %% ?SEV_IPRINT("[~w] try receive", [N]),
 6686:     %% if 
 6687:     %%     (N =:= (?TPP_SMALL_NUM-2)) -> 
 6688:     %%         ?SEV_IPRINT("[~w] try receive", [N]),
 6689:     %%         socket:setopt(Sock, otp, debug, true); 
 6690:     %%     true -> ok
 6691:     %% end,
 6692:     try tpp_udp_recv_req(Sock, Recv) of
 6693:         {ok, Msg, RecvSz, From} ->
 6694:             NewStart = if (Start =:= undefined) -> ?SLIB:timestamp(); 
 6695:                           true -> Start end,
 6696:             %% ?SEV_IPRINT("[~w] received - now try send", [N]),
 6697:             try tpp_udp_send_rep(Sock, Send, Msg, From) of
 6698:                 {ok, SendSz} ->
 6699:                     tpp_udp_server_handler_msg_exchange_loop(Sock, Send, Recv,
 6700:                                                              N+1,
 6701:                                                              Sent+SendSz,
 6702:                                                              Received+RecvSz,
 6703:                                                              NewStart);
 6704:                 {error, SReason} ->
 6705:                     ?SEV_EPRINT("send (~w): ~p", [N, SReason]),
 6706:                     exit({send, SReason, N})
 6707: 	    catch
 6708: 		SC:SE:SS ->
 6709: 		    exit({send, {SC, SE, SS}, N})
 6710:             end;
 6711:         {error, closed} ->
 6712:             ?SEV_IPRINT("closed - we are done: ~w, ~w, ~w",
 6713:                         [N, Sent, Received]),
 6714:             Stop = ?SLIB:timestamp(),
 6715:             {N, Sent, Received, Start, Stop};
 6716:         {error, RReason} ->
 6717:             ?SEV_EPRINT("recv (~w): ~p", [N, RReason]),
 6718:             exit({recv, RReason, N})
 6719:     catch
 6720: 	RC:RE:RS ->
 6721: 	    exit({recv, {RC, RE, RS}, N})	
 6722:     end.
 6723:   
 6724: 
 6725: %% The (remote) client side handler process
 6726: 
 6727: tpp_udp_client_handler_create(Node) ->
 6728:     Self = self(),
 6729:     Fun  = fun() -> put(sname, "chandler"), tpp_udp_client_handler(Self) end,
 6730:     erlang:spawn(Node, Fun).
 6731: 
 6732: tpp_udp_client_handler(Parent) ->
 6733:     tpp_udp_client_handler_init(Parent),
 6734:     ?SEV_IPRINT("await start command"),
 6735:     {ServerSA, Proto, BufInit, Send, Recv} = tpp_udp_handler_await_start(Parent),
 6736:     ?SEV_IPRINT("start command with"
 6737:                 "~n   ServerSA: ~p", [ServerSA]),
 6738:     Domain   = maps:get(family, ServerSA),
 6739:     Sock     = tpp_udp_sock_open(Domain, Proto, BufInit),
 6740:     Path     = tpp_udp_sock_bind(Sock, Domain),
 6741:     ?SEV_IPRINT("announce ready", []),
 6742:     tpp_udp_handler_announce_ready(Parent, init),
 6743:     {InitMsg, Num} = tpp_udp_handler_await_continue(Parent, send),
 6744:     ?SEV_IPRINT("received continue with"
 6745:                 "~n   Num: ~p", [Num]),
 6746:     Result = tpp_udp_client_handler_msg_exchange(Sock, ServerSA, 
 6747:                                                  Send, Recv, InitMsg, Num),
 6748:     ?SEV_IPRINT("ready"),
 6749:     tpp_udp_handler_announce_ready(Parent, send, Result),
 6750:     ?SEV_IPRINT("await terminate"),
 6751:     Reason = tpp_udp_handler_await_terminate(Parent),
 6752:     ?SEV_IPRINT("terminate with ~p", [Reason]),
 6753:     tpp_udp_sock_close(Sock, Path),
 6754:     ?SEV_IPRINT("terminating"),
 6755:     exit(Reason).
 6756: 
 6757: tpp_udp_client_handler_init(Parent) ->
 6758:     put(sname, "chandler"),
 6759:     ?SEV_IPRINT("init"),
 6760:     _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Parent),
 6761:     ok.
 6762: 
 6763: tpp_udp_client_handler_msg_exchange(Sock, ServerSA,
 6764:                                     Send, Recv, InitMsg, Num) ->
 6765:     Start = ?SLIB:timestamp(),
 6766:     tpp_udp_client_handler_msg_exchange_loop(Sock, ServerSA,
 6767:                                              Send, Recv, InitMsg,
 6768:                                              Num, 0, 0, 0, Start).
 6769: 
 6770: tpp_udp_client_handler_msg_exchange_loop(_Sock, _Dest, _Send, _Recv, _Msg,
 6771:                                          Num, Num, Sent, Received,
 6772:                                          Start) ->
 6773:     Stop = ?SLIB:timestamp(),
 6774:     {Sent, Received, Start, Stop};
 6775: tpp_udp_client_handler_msg_exchange_loop(Sock,
 6776: 					 #{family := local} = Dest,
 6777: 					 Send, Recv, Data,
 6778:                                          Num, N, Sent, Received, Start) ->
 6779:     case tpp_udp_send_req(Sock, Send, Data, Dest) of
 6780:         {ok, SendSz} ->
 6781:             case tpp_udp_recv_rep(Sock, Recv) of
 6782:                 {ok, NewData, RecvSz, Dest} ->
 6783:                     tpp_udp_client_handler_msg_exchange_loop(Sock, Dest,
 6784:                                                              Send, Recv,
 6785:                                                              NewData, Num, N+1,
 6786:                                                              Sent+SendSz, 
 6787:                                                              Received+RecvSz, 
 6788:                                                              Start);
 6789:                 {error, RReason} ->
 6790:                     ?SEV_EPRINT("recv (~w of ~w): ~p", [N, Num, RReason]),
 6791:                     exit({recv, RReason, N})
 6792:             end;
 6793:         {error, SReason} ->
 6794:             ?SEV_EPRINT("send (~w of ~w): ~p", [N, Num, SReason]),
 6795:             exit({send, SReason, N})
 6796:     end;
 6797: tpp_udp_client_handler_msg_exchange_loop(Sock,
 6798: 					 #{addr := Addr, port := Port} = Dest0,
 6799: 					 Send, Recv, Data,
 6800:                                          Num, N, Sent, Received, Start) ->
 6801:     case tpp_udp_send_req(Sock, Send, Data, Dest0) of
 6802:         {ok, SendSz} ->
 6803:             case tpp_udp_recv_rep(Sock, Recv) of
 6804:                 {ok, NewData, RecvSz, #{addr := Addr, port := Port} = Dest1} ->
 6805:                     tpp_udp_client_handler_msg_exchange_loop(Sock, Dest1,
 6806:                                                              Send, Recv,
 6807:                                                              NewData, Num, N+1,
 6808:                                                              Sent+SendSz, 
 6809:                                                              Received+RecvSz, 
 6810:                                                              Start);
 6811:                 {error, RReason} ->
 6812:                     ?SEV_EPRINT("recv (~w of ~w): ~p", [N, Num, RReason]),
 6813:                     exit({recv, RReason, N})
 6814:             end;
 6815:         {error, SReason} ->
 6816:             ?SEV_EPRINT("send (~w of ~w): ~p", [N, Num, SReason]),
 6817:             exit({send, SReason, N})
 6818:     end.
 6819: 
 6820: 
 6821: tpp_udp_recv_req(Sock, Recv) ->
 6822:     tpp_udp_recv(Sock, Recv, ?TPP_REQUEST).
 6823: 
 6824: tpp_udp_recv_rep(Sock, Recv) ->
 6825:     tpp_udp_recv(Sock, Recv, ?TPP_REPLY).
 6826: 
 6827: tpp_udp_recv(Sock, Recv, Tag) ->
 6828:     %% ok = socket:setopt(Sock, otp, debug, true),
 6829:     try Recv(Sock, 0) of
 6830:         {ok, {Source, <<Tag:32/integer, Sz:32/integer, Data/binary>> = Msg}} 
 6831:           when (Sz =:= size(Data)) ->
 6832: 	    %% ok = socket:setopt(Sock, otp, debug, false),
 6833:             %% We got it all
 6834:             %% ?SEV_IPRINT("tpp_udp_recv -> got all: "
 6835:             %%             "~n   Source:     ~p"
 6836:             %%             "~n   Tag:        ~p"
 6837:             %%             "~n   Sz:         ~p"
 6838:             %%             "~n   size(Data): ~p",
 6839:             %%             [Source, Tag, Sz, size(Data)]),
 6840:             {ok, Data, size(Msg), Source};
 6841:         {ok, {_Source, <<Tag:32/integer, Sz:32/integer, Data/binary>>}} ->
 6842: 	    %% ok = socket:setopt(Sock, otp, debug, false),
 6843:             {error, {invalid_msg, Sz, size(Data)}};
 6844:         {ok, {_, <<Tag:32/integer, _/binary>>}} ->
 6845: 	    %% ok = socket:setopt(Sock, otp, debug, false),
 6846:             {error, {invalid_msg_tag, Tag}};
 6847:         {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6848: 	    %% ok = socket:setopt(Sock, otp, debug, false),
 6849:             ERROR
 6850:     catch
 6851: 	C:E:S ->
 6852: 	    {error, {caught, C, E, S}}
 6853:     end.
 6854: 
 6855: tpp_udp_send_req(Sock, Send, Data, Dest) ->
 6856:     tpp_udp_send(Sock, Send, ?TPP_REQUEST, Data, Dest).
 6857: 
 6858: tpp_udp_send_rep(Sock, Send, Data, Dest) ->
 6859:     tpp_udp_send(Sock, Send, ?TPP_REPLY, Data, Dest).
 6860: 
 6861: tpp_udp_send(Sock, Send, Tag, Data, Dest) ->
 6862:     DataSz = size(Data),
 6863:     Msg    = <<Tag:32/integer, DataSz:32/integer, Data/binary>>,
 6864:     tpp_udp_send_msg(Sock, Send, Msg, Dest, 0).
 6865: 
 6866: tpp_udp_send_msg(Sock, Send, Msg, Dest, AccSz) when is_binary(Msg) ->
 6867:     case Send(Sock, Msg, Dest) of
 6868:         ok ->
 6869:             {ok, AccSz+size(Msg)};
 6870:         {ok, Rest} -> % This is an IOVec
 6871:             RestBin = list_to_binary(Rest),
 6872:             tpp_udp_send_msg(Sock, Send, RestBin, Dest,
 6873:                              AccSz+(size(Msg)-size(RestBin)));
 6874:         {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6875:             ERROR
 6876:     end.
 6877:     
 6878: 
 6879: tpp_udp_handler_await_start(Parent) ->
 6880:     ?SEV_IPRINT("await start"),
 6881:     ?SEV_AWAIT_START(Parent).
 6882: 
 6883: tpp_udp_handler_announce_ready(Parent, Slogan) ->
 6884:     ?SEV_IPRINT("announce ready (~p)", [Slogan]),
 6885:     ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Parent, Slogan).
 6886: tpp_udp_handler_announce_ready(Parent, Slogan, Extra) ->
 6887:     ?SEV_IPRINT("announce ready (~p)", [Slogan]),
 6888:     ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Parent, Slogan, Extra).
 6889: 
 6890: tpp_udp_handler_await_continue(Parent, Slogan) ->
 6891:     ?SEV_IPRINT("await continue (~p)", [Slogan]),
 6892:     case ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Parent, parent, Slogan) of
 6893:         ok ->
 6894:             ?SEV_IPRINT("continue (~p): ok", [Slogan]),
 6895:             ok;
 6896:         {ok, Data} ->
 6897:             ?SEV_IPRINT("continue (~p): ok with data", [Slogan]),
 6898:             Data;
 6899:         {error, Reason} ->
 6900:             ?SEV_EPRINT("continue (~p): error"
 6901:                         "~n   ~p", [Slogan, Reason]),
 6902:             exit({continue, Slogan, Reason})
 6903:     end.
 6904: 
 6905: tpp_udp_handler_await_terminate(Parent) ->
 6906:     ?SEV_IPRINT("await terminate"),
 6907:     case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Parent, parent) of
 6908:         ok ->
 6909:             ok;
 6910:         {error, Reason} ->
 6911:             Reason
 6912:     end.
 6913: 
 6914: 
 6915: tpp_udp_sock_open(Domain, Proto, BufInit) ->
 6916:     case socket:open(Domain, dgram, Proto) of
 6917:         {ok, Sock} ->
 6918:             ok = BufInit(Sock),
 6919:             Sock;
 6920:         {error, Reason} ->
 6921:             exit({open_failed, Reason})
 6922:     end.
 6923: 
 6924: tpp_udp_sock_bind(Sock, Domain) ->
 6925:     LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
 6926:     case socket:bind(Sock, LSA) of
 6927:         ok ->
 6928:             ok;
 6929:         {error, Reason} ->
 6930:             exit({bind, Reason})
 6931:     end.
 6932: 
 6933: tpp_udp_sock_close(Sock, Path) ->
 6934:     case socket:close(Sock) of
 6935:         ok ->
 6936:             unlink_path(Path),
 6937:             ok;
 6938:         {error, Reason} ->
 6939:             ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed closing socket: "
 6940:                         "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
 6941:             unlink_path(Path),
 6942:             {error, {close, Reason}}
 6943:     end.
 6944: 
 6945: 
 6946: 
 6947: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6948: 
 6949: sock_bind(Sock, LSA) ->
 6950:     try socket:bind(Sock, LSA) of
 6951:         ok = OK ->
 6952:             OK;
 6953:         {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason} ->
 6954:             ?SEV_IPRINT("Address not available"),
 6955:             throw({skip, Reason});
 6956:         {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6957:             ERROR
 6958:     catch
 6959:         C:E:S ->
 6960:             ?FAIL({bind, C, E, S})
 6961:     end.
 6962: 
 6963: 
 6964: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6965: 
 6966: local_host() ->
 6967:     try net_adm:localhost() of
 6968:         Host when is_list(Host) ->
 6969: 	    %% Convert to shortname if long
 6970: 	    case string:tokens(Host, [$.]) of
 6971: 		[H|_] ->
 6972: 		    list_to_atom(H)
 6973: 	    end
 6974:     catch
 6975:         C:E:S ->
 6976:             erlang:raise(C, E, S)
 6977:     end.
 6978: 
 6979: 
 6980: %% The point of this is to "ensure" that paths from different test runs
 6981: %% don't clash.
 6982: 
 6983: mk_unique_path() ->
 6984:     ?SLIB:mk_unique_path().
 6985: 
 6986: 
 6987: which_local_socket_addr(local = Domain) ->
 6988:     #{family => Domain,
 6989:       path   => mk_unique_path()};
 6990: 
 6991: %% This gets the local socket address (not 127.0...)
 6992: %% We should really implement this using the (new) net module,
 6993: %% but until that gets the necessary functionality...
 6994: which_local_socket_addr(Domain) ->
 6995:     case ?KLIB:which_local_host_info(Domain) of
 6996:         {ok, [#{addr := Addr}|_]} ->
 6997:             #{family => Domain,
 6998:               addr   => Addr};
 6999:         {error, Reason} ->
 7000:             ?FAIL(Reason)
 7001:     end.

 7006: %% Here are all the *general* test case condition functions.
 7007: 
 7008: etc_issue() ->
 7009:     string:trim(os:cmd("cat /etc/issue")).
 7010: 
 7011: is_old_fedora16() ->
 7012:     is_old_fedora16( etc_issue() ).
 7013: 
 7014: %% We actually only have one host running this, a slow VM.
 7015: is_old_fedora16("Fedora release 16 " ++ _) ->
 7016:     skip("Very slow VM");
 7017: is_old_fedora16(_) ->
 7018:     ok.
 7019: 
 7020: 
 7021: %% This is a bit subjective, but...
 7022: %% ..we have some WMs that is not "fast enough", but the only
 7023: %% thing we can test on is 'esock factor' (other than host name).
 7024: %% This means we actually skip this on platforms where its
 7025: %% not actually needed.
 7026: %% The host in question is a Ubuntu 20.04...
 7027: is_slow_ubuntu(Config) ->
 7028:     case lookup(kernel_factor, 1, Config) of
 7029: 	F when is_integer(F) andalso (F > 1) ->
 7030: 	    case os:type() of
 7031: 		{unix, linux} ->
 7032: 		    case etc_issue() of
 7033: 			"Ubuntu 20.04" ++ _ ->
 7034: 			    skip("Slow Ubuntu host");
 7035: 			_ ->
 7036: 			    ok
 7037: 		    end;
 7038: 		_ ->
 7039: 		    ok
 7040: 	    end;
 7041: 	_ ->
 7042: 	    ok
 7043:     end.
 7044: 
 7045: 
 7046: is_not_windows() ->
 7047:     case os:type() of
 7048:         {win32, nt} ->
 7049:             skip("This does not work on Windows");
 7050:         _ ->
 7051:             ok
 7052:     end.
 7053: 
 7054: has_support_unix_domain_socket() ->
 7055:     case socket:is_supported(local) of
 7056: 	true ->
 7057: 	    ok;
 7058: 	false ->
 7059: 	    skip("Not supported")
 7060:     end.
 7061: 
 7062: has_support_sctp() ->
 7063:     case os:type() of
 7064:         {win32, _} ->
 7065:             skip("Not supported");
 7066:         {unix, netbsd} ->
 7067:             %% XYZ We will have to investigate this later...
 7068:             skip("Not supported");
 7069:         _ ->
 7070:             case socket:is_supported(sctp) of
 7071:                 true ->
 7072:                     ok;
 7073:                 false ->
 7074:                     skip("Not supported")
 7075:             end
 7076:     end.
 7077:

 7080: %% support for IPv4 or IPv6. If not, there is no point in running corresponding tests.
 7081: %% Currently we just skip.

 7083:     ?KLIB:has_support_ipv4().
 7084:

 7091: unlink_path(Path) ->
 7092:     unlink_path(Path, fun() -> ok end, fun() -> ok end).
 7093: 
 7094: unlink_path(Path, Success, Failure)
 7095:   when is_function(Success, 0), is_function(Failure, 0) ->
 7096:     case Path of
 7097:         undefined ->
 7098:             ?SEV_IPRINT("not a path to unlink"),
 7099:                     Success();
 7100:         _ ->
 7101:             ?SEV_IPRINT("try unlink path: "
 7102:                         "~n   ~s", [Path]),
 7103:             case file:delete(Path) of
 7104:                 ok ->
 7105:                     ?SEV_IPRINT("path unlinked: "
 7106:                                 "~n   Path: ~s", [Path]),
 7107:                     Success();
 7108:                 Error ->
 7109:                     ?SEV_EPRINT("unlink failed: "
 7110:                                 "~n   Path: ~s"
 7111:                                 "~n   Res:  ~p", [Path, Error]),
 7112:                     Failure()
 7113:             end
 7114:     end.

 7131: lookup(Key, Default, Config) ->
 7132:     case lists:keysearch(Key, 1, Config) of
 7133:         {value, {Key, Value}} ->
 7134:             Value;
 7135:         _ ->
 7136:             Default
 7137:     end.

 7142: tdiff({A1, B1, C1} = _T1x, {A2, B2, C2} = _T2x) ->
 7143:     T1 = A1*1000000000+B1*1000+(C1 div 1000), 
 7144:     T2 = A2*1000000000+B2*1000+(C2 div 1000), 
 7145:     T2 - T1.

 7155: 
 7156: start_node(Name) ->
 7157:     start_node(Name, 5000).
 7158: 
 7159: start_node(Name, Timeout) when is_integer(Timeout) andalso (Timeout > 0) ->
 7160:     Pa   = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 7161:     Args = ["-pa", Pa,
 7162:             "-s", atom_to_list(?PROXY), "start", atom_to_list(node()),
 7163:             "-s", "global", "sync"],
 7164:     try ?CT_PEER(#{name      => Name,
 7165:                    wait_boot => Timeout,
 7166:                    args      => Args}) of
 7167:         {ok, Peer, Node} ->
 7168:             ?SEV_IPRINT("Started node ~p - now (global) sync", [Name]),
 7169:             global:sync(), % Again, just in case...
 7170:             ?SEV_IPRINT("ping proxy"),
 7171:             pong = ?PPING(Node),
 7172:             {Peer, Node};
 7173:         {error, Reason} ->
 7174:             ?SEV_EPRINT("failed starting node ~p (=> SKIP):"
 7175:                         "~n   ~p", [Name, Reason]),
 7176:             skip(Reason)
 7177:     catch
 7178:         Class:Reason:Stack ->
 7179:             ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed starting node: "
 7180:                         "~n   Class:  ~p"
 7181:                         "~n   Reason: ~p"
 7182:                         "~n   Stack:  ~p",
 7183:                         [Class, Reason, Stack]),
 7184:             skip({node_start, Class, Reason})
 7185:     end.
 7186: 
 7187:

 7189: 
 7190: sock_port(S) ->
 7191:     case socket:sockname(S) of
 7192:         {ok, #{port := Port}} -> Port;
 7193:         {ok, #{}}             -> undefined
 7194:     end.
 7195: 
 7196: l2b(L) when is_list(L) ->
 7197:     list_to_binary(L).
 7198: 
 7199: b2l(B) when is_binary(B) ->
 7200:     binary_to_list(B).
 7201: 
 7202: i(F) ->
 7203:     i(F, []).
 7204: 
 7205: i(F, A) ->
 7206:     FStr = ?F("[~s] " ++ F, [?FTS()|A]),
 7207:     io:format(user, FStr ++ "~n", []),
 7208:     io:format(FStr, []).
 7209:
